Name.label: Dysostosis with brachydactyly without extraskeletal manifestations

TextSection.Contents: Mononen-Karnes-Senac syndrome is characterized by skeletal dysplasia associated with finger malformations (brachydactyly with short and abducted thumbs, short index fingers, and markedly short and abducted great toes), variable mild short stature, and mild bowleg with overgrowth of the fibula. It has been described in two males, their mothers, and a maternal aunt. Females are less severely affected than males. X-linked dominant inheritance is suggested.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
